definitions.definition: a person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident:
examples: Police are appealing for witnesses to the accident to come forward.
She was witness to the tragic event.

definitions.definition: someone who is asked to be present at a particular event and sign their name in order to prove that things have been done correctly:
examples: He signed the treaty in the presence of two witnesses.

definitions.definition: to see something happen, especially an accident or crime:
to be present at an event and to sign your name as proof that it happened or that it was done correctly:
examples: Her will was witnessed by two colleagues.
